title: Agent-Based Output Drift Detection for Breast Cancer Response Prediction in a Multisite Clinical Decision Support System
summary: Modern clinical decision support systems can concurrently serve multiple, independent medical imaging institutions, but their predictive performance may degrade across sites due to variations in patient populations, imaging hardware, and acquisition protocols. Continuous surveillance of predictive model outputs offers a safe and reliable approach for identifying such distributional shifts without ground truth labels.
